trans-unit.source: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions
trans-unit.target: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions.

trans-unit.source: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions
trans-unit.target: How to deploy an Azure API Management service instance to multiple Azure regions

trans-unit.source: API Management supports multi-region deployment which enables API publishers to distribute a single API management service across any number of desired Azure regions.
trans-unit.target: API Management supports multi-region deployment which enables API publishers to distribute a single API management service across any number of desired Azure regions.

trans-unit.source: This helps reduce request latency perceived by geographically distributed API consumers and also improves service availability if one region goes offline.
trans-unit.target: This helps reduce request latency perceived by geographically distributed API consumers and also improves service availability if one region goes offline.

trans-unit.source: When an API Management service is created initially, it contains only one [unit][] and resides in a single Azure region, which is designated as the Primary Region.
trans-unit.target: When an API Management service is created initially, it contains only one [unit][] and resides in a single Azure region, which is designated as the Primary Region.

trans-unit.source: Additional regions can be easily added through Azure Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: Additional regions can be easily added through Azure Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: API Management gateway server is deployed to each region and call traffic will be routed to the closest gateway.
trans-unit.target: API Management gateway server is deployed to each region and call traffic will be routed to the closest gateway.

trans-unit.source: If a region goes offline, the traffic is automatically re-directed to the next closest gateway.
trans-unit.target: If a region goes offline, the traffic is automatically re-directed to the next closest gateway.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Multi-region deployment is only available in the **[Premium][]** tier.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Multi-region deployment is only available in the **[Premium][]** tier.

trans-unit.source: Deploy an API Management service instance to a new region
trans-unit.target: Deploy an API Management service instance to a new region

trans-unit.source: To get started, click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: ![Publisher portal][api-management-management-console]
trans-unit.target: ![Publisher portal][api-management-management-console]

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the **Scale** tab in Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the **Scale** tab in Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: ![Scale tab][api-management-scale-service]
trans-unit.target: ![Scale tab][api-management-scale-service]

trans-unit.source: To deploy to a new region, click on the drop-down list below the primary region and pick a region from the list.
trans-unit.target: To deploy to a new region, click on the drop-down list below the primary region and pick a region from the list.

trans-unit.source: ![Add region][api-management-add-region]
trans-unit.target: ![Add region][api-management-add-region]

trans-unit.source: Once the region is selected, pick the number of units for the new region from the unit drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Once the region is selected, pick the number of units for the new region from the unit drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: ![Specify units][api-management-select-units]
trans-unit.target: ![Specify units][api-management-select-units]

trans-unit.source: Once the desired regions and units are configured, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired regions and units are configured, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Delete an API Management service instance from a region
trans-unit.target: Delete an API Management service instance from a region

trans-unit.source: To remove an API Management service instance from a region, navigate to the **Scale** tab in Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: To remove an API Management service instance from a region, navigate to the **Scale** tab in Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: ![Scale tab][api-management-scale-service]
trans-unit.target: ![Scale tab][api-management-scale-service]

trans-unit.source: Click the **X** to the right of the desired region to remove.
trans-unit.target: Click the **X** to the right of the desired region to remove.

trans-unit.source: ![Remove region][api-management-remove-region]
trans-unit.target: ![Remove region][api-management-remove-region]

trans-unit.source: Once the desired regions are removed, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Once the desired regions are removed, click **Save**.
